Question
========

Suppose the probability distribution of *X* = the number of jobs per student at a university in the past year is as follows:_____________. \

  ------------------ ------ ------ ------ ------ ------ Number of jobs *X* 0 1 2 3 4 Odds 0.14 0.37 0.29 0.15 0.05 ------------------ ------ ------ ------ ------ ------

\ Then, choosing a random student, what is the probability that they had one or two jobs during the past year, such as P (X = 1 or X = 2)?

Answerlist
----------

* 0,14
* 0,29
* 0,37
* 0,66

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.14: Incorrect
* 0.29: Incorrect
* 0.37: Incorrect
* 0.66: Correct
